summary: This is an email chain from June 2019 discussing scheduling a meeting to talk about the plan for the Epstein case. It involves personnel from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY), including the Chief of the Criminal Division.

persons.name: Janis
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who confirmed that Jenn Ranucci is the new supervisor. The email author raised an issue with Janis.

persons.name: Jenn Ranucci
persons.context: Identified as the new supervisor with whom the email author has a relationship and plans to meet regarding the Epstein matter.

persons.name: Russell
persons.context: An individual whom the Chief of the Criminal Division wants to include in a meeting about the Epstein case plan.

connections.description: Janis confirmed to the email author that Jenn Ranucci is the new supervisor.

events.title: Request for Epstein Case Meeting
events.description: The Chief of the Criminal Division requests a meeting with another attorney and Russell to discuss the plan for the Epstein case.

events.title: Email Coordination on Epstein Matter
events.description: Email chain discusses waiting until the following Thursday for a meeting and arranging an interim meeting with the new supervisor, Jenn Ranucci.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email chain from June 2019 regarding the Epstein case within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
It reveals active planning and coordination among SDNY attorneys and supervisors regarding the Epstein case strategy.
The Chief of the Criminal Division is seeking a meeting to discuss the 'plan for the Epstein case,' indicating high-level management of the prosecution.
The email mentions a personnel change, with Jenn Ranucci identified as a new supervisor on the matter.
